"The Lady of Shalott" is a ballad by the English poet Alfred, Lord Tennyson (1809
1892). Like his other early poems  "Sir Lancelot and Queen Guinevere", and "
Galahad"  the poem recasts Arthurian subject matter loosely based on medieval 
sources. Tennyson wrote two versions of the poem, one published in 1833, of 20 
... Out flew the web and floated wide-: The mirror crack'd from side to side;...
